item.title: Announcing CTP Ethiopia 2021 Summer Session
item.dc:creator: team
item.description: Due to numerous requests we have received, we have decided to extend the application deadline until Monday, June 29, 11:59 pm EST. You will be notified of application status in early July. Sessions will start July 5th. Thank you to those of you who applied and we look forward to reading the rest of your […]

item.title: CTP Alumni Whereabouts
item.dc:creator: team
item.description: Now that most of the early and regular decisions are out, we wanted to highlight some of our CTP Alumni who have been accepted to prestigious colleges abroad this year.

item.title: Spring Sessions 2021
item.dc:creator: team
item.description: Spring Sessions are back! We are pleased to announce that CTP will be holding its annual Spring Sessions event this weekend over Zoom, and you are all invited! We will discuss everything about the College Application Process. We will talk about the Common Application, Standardized Tests, Financial Aid, Essays, and a whole lot more. Nothing […]

item.title: CTP Podcast with Bruk and Debi
item.dc:creator: bruk
item.description: We are back with the second episode which mainly focused on Gap Year and how to prepare for it. Bruk and Debi share their experiences with a gap year in this episode. They also talk about some of the aspects of the college application process. We hope this episode will be helpful to all of […]

item.title: CTP Podcast with Guest – Rediet
item.dc:creator: debi
item.description: Podcast Episode one, discussing college application with Rediet Bekele, a senior at Columbia and the president of CTP. Podcast Hosted by Debi Ejeta, a sophomore at Columbia from CTP’s communications team. In this podcast, Rediet and Debi discuss college applications and Rediet’s experience as an applicant. They also drop some tips on how to cope […]

item.title: Getting Ready To Apply
item.dc:creator: team
item.description: By Aaron Kebede and Amerti Gudissa   Hello CTP Fam, Hoping you are doing well in these extraordinary times, we at CTP would like to encourage and support you. Believe it or not, like it or not, this is a once in a lifetime event, where you have all the time in the world to […]

item.title: Waitlists and Gap Years
item.dc:creator: dagim
item.description: Selam selam everyone! Since rolling decisions’ results are “rolling” in, this week’s post will be about waitlists and gap years! If you’ve applied to a bunch of colleges before, chances are you’ve been waitlisted to a couple of them. Being waitlisted for a college means you’ve been put on a list of applicants whom a […]

item.title: More on Getting Ready to Apply
item.dc:creator: debi
item.description: We are into March and we are fast approaching the climax of the application season. As most of you are waiting for your application decisions, we talked about the alternatives that are available for you last week in our segment on Rolling Decisions. This week we are going to take a turn and talk to […]

item.title: Rolling Admissions
item.dc:creator: benyam
item.description: Today we will be talking about Rolling Admissions. Rolling Admission is a part of the application cycle for some colleges in which the schools evaluate applications as they are received, with out any set deadlines. one advantage of rolling admissions is getting quicker responses from the colleges. Since the schools release decisions on an on-going […]

item.title: Recommendation Letters
item.dc:creator: bruk
item.description: Recommendations are  a very important, and yet the most underestimated, part of the college applications. By now you may have heard the spiel that admission officers expect very highly of your personal statements (the college application essays) mostly because it’s the only place where they get to know and, depending on how good you are […]
